title: Font management; Master Juggler
content:
I know we've been thru this a couple of times, but I'm looking for a font utility, as it becomes clearer that FontBook will not work the way we like. Right now I'm using a demo of Suitcase 11, and it works alright (still miss ATM tough). But I haven't read anything about [Alsoft's Masterjuggler](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000601/http:/www.alsoft.com/MasterJuggler/index.html), which seems to have a pretty neat interface.   
Does it have auto-activation?   
Any experiences out there?
author: lettertiep

comments.content:
I have yet to give it a go myself, but there was some additional discussion regarding MasterJuggler on Typographica back in May and July. The second article is probably the mostly enlightening.   
   
 [MasterJuggler Sneaks Into OS X Font Fracas](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000601/http:/typographi.ca/000605.php)   
   
 [MasterJuggler 3 Released](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000601/http:/typographi.ca/000639.php)   
   
And according to [this recent thread](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525000601/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/13801.html) auto-activation is due in a future release.

Like I've said before, I've used them all and MasterJuggler is the one I'm sticking with.   
   
The best thing was that Alsoft honored my 10 year old purchase of MasterJuggler (for system 7) and sold me a license for the upgrade price.
Nice. I like companies that actually like their customers too.
